definitions.definition: To put letters or words written in another writing system into the Latin (Roman) alphabet .
examples: The author romanizes Chinese names using the Wadeâ€“Giles system rather than the Pinyin system.

definitions.definition: To bring under the authority or influence of Rome.
To make or become Roman in character or style .
To make or become Roman Catholic in religion (by conversion), character or style .
To fill with Latin words or idioms.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To put letters or words written in another writing system into the Latin (Roman) alphabet .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , historical , usually capitalized ) To bring under the authority or influence of Rome.
( ambitransitive , usually capitalized ) To make or become Roman in character or style .
( ambitransitive , usually capitalized ) To make or become Roman Catholic in religion (by conversion), character or style .
( transitive , obsolete ) To fill with Latin words or idioms.
